name: Kepler-391
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-391 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-391 is a star with 6.603999999999994 times the mass of the Sun, and 3.57 times its radius. It is located 2907.78 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-391 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-391 b

Kepler-391 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 7.42 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-391.

The mass of Kepler-391 b is 15.62 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-391 b is 3.2 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-391 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-391 c

Kepler-391 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.16 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 20.49 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-391.

The mass of Kepler-391 c is 20.02 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-391 c is 3.54 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-391 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-391, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
